attribute.name: for
attribute.description: If present, this attribute refers to the value of one of the exposed attached objects within the composite component inside of which this tag is nested.

attribute.name: listener
attribute.description: MethodExpression representing an action listener method that will be notified when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes an LazyActionListener parameter, with a return type of void, or to a public method that takes no arguments with a return type of void

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: Value binding expression that evaluates to an object that implements ActionListener.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Fully qualified Java class name of an ActionListener to be created and registered.

component.name: ajax
component.description: The <a4j:ajax> behavior allows Ajax capability to be added to a non-Ajax component. The non-Ajax component must implement the ClientBehaviorHolder interface for all the event attributes that support behavior rendering.

attribute.name: bypassUpdates
attribute.description: If "true", after process validations phase it skips updates of model beans on a force render response. It can be used for validating components input

attribute.name: disabled
attribute.description: If "true", do not initiate an ajax request when the associated event is observed

attribute.name: execute
attribute.description: Ids of components that will participate in the "execute" portion of the Request Processing Lifecycle. Can be a single id, a space or comma separated list of Id's, or an EL Expression evaluating to an array or Collection. Any of the keywords "@this", "@form", "@all", "@none", "@region" may be specified in the identifier list. Some components make use of additional keywords. Default value is "@region" which resolves to parent component if no region is present.

attribute.name: limitRender
attribute.description: If "true", render only those ids specified in the "render" attribute, forgoing the render of the auto-rendered panels

attribute.name: onbeforedomupdate
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called after the ajax response comes back, but before the DOM is updated

attribute.name: onbegin
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called before an ajax request.

attribute.name: onerror
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when an error has occurred during Ajax communications

attribute.name: render
attribute.description: Ids of components that will participate in the "render" portion of the Request Processing Lifecycle. Can be a single id, a space or comma separated list of Id's, or an EL Expression evaluating to an array or Collection. Any of the keywords "@this", "@form", "@all", "@none", "@region" may be specified in the identifier list. Some components make use of additional keywords

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: Name of the request status component that will indicate the status of the Ajax request

attribute.name: data
attribute.description: Serialized (on default with JSON) data passed to the client by a developer on an AJAX request. It's accessible via "event.data" syntax. Both primitive types and complex types such as arrays and collections can be serialized and used with data

attribute.name: event
attribute.description: Name of JavaScript event property (click, change, etc.) of parent component that triggers the behavior. If the event attribute is not defined, the behavior is triggered on the event that normally provides interaction behavior for the parent component. The value cannot be an EL expression.

attribute.name: immediate
attribute.description: Flag indicating that, if this component is activated by the user, notifications should be delivered to interested listeners and actions immediately (that is, during Apply Request Values phase) rather than waiting until Invoke Application phase.

attribute.name: listener
attribute.description: Method expression referencing a method that will be called when an AjaxBehaviorEvent has been broadcast for the listener.

attribute.name: onbeforesubmit
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called before the AJAX request is submitted

attribute.name: oncomplete
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called after the DOM is updated

attribute.name: queueId
attribute.description: Identify the name of the destination queue

attribute.name: resetValues
attribute.description: If true, indicate that this particular Ajax transaction is a value reset transaction. This will cause resetValue() to be called on any EditableValueHolder instances encountered as a result of this ajax transaction. If not specified, or the value is false, no such indication is made.

component.name: attachQueue
component.description: The <a4j:attachQueue> behavior is used together with a <a4j:queue> component to further customize queuing for particular components and behaviors. The <a4j:attachQueue> behavior can override the scope-wide queue settings for an individual component, or attach specific requests to a queue.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: The value binding expression used to wire up this component to a component property of a JavaBean class

attribute.name: ignoreDupResponses
attribute.description: Attribute allows you to ignore an Ajax response produced by a request if the newest 'similar' request is in the queue already. ignoreDupResponses="true" does not cancel the request while it is processed on the server, but just allows avoiding unnecessary updates on the client side if the response isn't actual now

attribute.name: onrequestdequeue
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called after the request is removed from the queue

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: requestGroupingId
attribute.description: Specify the groupingId to process multiple requests together. Requests from multiple  behaviors can use the same identifier to group requests together

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Identify the name of the destination queue

attribute.name: onrequestqueue
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when the request is added to the queue

attribute.name: requestDelay
attribute.description: Attribute defines the time (in ms) the request will be waiting in the queue before it is ready to be sent.

component.name: commandButton
component.description: The <a4j:commandButton> component is similar to the JavaServer Faces (JSF) <h:commandButton> component, but additionally includes Ajax support.

attribute.name: accesskey
attribute.description: Access key that, when pressed, transfers focus to this element.

attribute.name: actionListener
attribute.description: MethodExpression representing an action listener method that will be notified when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes an ActionEvent parameter, with a return type of void, or to a public method that takes no arguments with a return type of void. In the latter case, the method has no way of easily knowing where the event came from, but this can be useful in cases where a notification is needed that "some action happened".

attribute.name: bypassUpdates
attribute.description: If "true", after process validations phase it skips updates of model beans on a force render response. It can be used for validating components input.

attribute.name: disabled
attribute.description: Flag indicating that this element must never receive focus or be included in a subsequent submit. Default value - "false"

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.

attribute.name: immediate
attribute.description: Flag indicating that, if this component is activated by the user, notifications should be delivered to interested listeners and actions immediately (that is, during Apply Request Values phase) rather than waiting until Invoke Application phase.

attribute.name: onbeforedomupdate
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called after the ajax response comes back, but before the DOM is updated

attribute.name: onclick
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is clicked over this element.

attribute.name: ondblclick
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is double clicked over this element.

attribute.name: onkeydown
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a key is pressed down over this element.

attribute.name: onkeyup
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a key is released over this element.

attribute.name: onmousemove
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved within this element.

attribute.name: onmouseover
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved onto this element.

attribute.name: render
attribute.description: Ids of components that will participate in the "render" portion of the Request Processing Lifecycle. Can be a single id, a space or comma separated list of Id's, or an EL Expression evaluating to an array or Collection. Any of the keywords "@this", "@form", "@all", "@none", "@region" may be specified in the identifier list. Some components make use of additional keywords

attribute.name: resetValues
attribute.description: If true, indicate that this particular Ajax transaction is a value reset transaction. This will cause resetValue() to be called on any EditableValueHolder instances encountered as a result of this ajax transaction. If not specified, or the value is false, no such indication is made.

attribute.name: style
attribute.description: CSS style(s) to be applied when this component is rendered.

attribute.name: tabindex
attribute.description: This attribute specifies the position of the current element in the tabbing order for the current document. This value must be a number between 0 and 32767. User agents should ignore leading zeros

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Type of button to create. Can be one of "submit", "button", "image" and "reset". If not specified, the default value is "submit".

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: MethodExpression representing the application action to invoke when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes no parameters, and returns an Object (the toString() of which is called to derive the logical outcome) which is passed to the NavigationHandler for this application.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: The value binding expression used to wire up this component to a component property of a JavaBean class

attribute.name: data
attribute.description: Serialized (on default with JSON) data passed to the client by a developer on an AJAX request. It's accessible via "event.data" syntax. Both primitive types and complex types such as arrays and collections can be serialized and used with data

attribute.name: execute
attribute.description: Ids of components that will participate in the "execute" portion of the Request Processing Lifecycle. Can be a single id, a space or comma separated list of Id's, or an EL Expression evaluating to an array or Collection. Any of the keywords "@this", "@form", "@all", "@none", "@region" may be specified in the identifier list. Some components make use of additional keywords. Default value is "@region" which resolves to form if no region is present.

attribute.name: image
attribute.description: Absolute or relative URL of the image to be displayed for this button. If specified, this "input" element will be of type "image". Otherwise, it will be of the type specified by the "type" property with a label specified by the "value" property

attribute.name: limitRender
attribute.description: If "true", render only those ids specified in the "render" attribute, forgoing the render of the auto-rendered panels

attribute.name: onbegin
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called before an ajax request.

attribute.name: oncomplete
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called after the DOM is updated

attribute.name: onerror
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when the request results in an error

attribute.name: onkeypress
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a key is pressed and released over this element.

attribute.name: onmousedown
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is pressed down over this element.

attribute.name: onmouseout
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved away from this element.

attribute.name: onmouseup
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is released over this element.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: Name of the request status component that will indicate the status of the Ajax request

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.description: Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) to be applied when this element is rendered. This value must be passed through as the "class" attribute on generated markup.

attribute.name: title
attribute.description: Advisory title information about markup elements generated for this component.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: The current value of this component.

component.name: commandLink
component.description: The <a4j:commandLink> component is similar to the JavaServer Faces (JSF) <h:commandLink> component, except that it includes plugged-in Ajax behavior.

attribute.name: accesskey
attribute.description: Access key that, when pressed, transfers focus to this element.

attribute.name: actionListener
attribute.description: MethodExpression representing an action listener method that will be notified when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes an ActionEvent parameter, with a return type of void, or to a public method that takes no arguments with a return type of void. In the latter case, the method has no way of easily knowing where the event came from, but this can be useful in cases where a notification is needed that "some action happened".

attribute.name: bypassUpdates
attribute.description: If "true", after process validations phase it skips updates of model beans on a force render response. It can be used for validating components input.

attribute.name: coords
attribute.description: The position and shape of the hot spot on the screen (for use in client-side image maps).

attribute.name: disabled
attribute.description: Flag indicating that this element must never receive focus or be included in a subsequent submit. Default value - "false"

attribute.name: hreflang
attribute.description: The language code of the resource designated by this hyperlink.

attribute.name: immediate
attribute.description: Flag indicating that, if this component is activated by the user, notifications should be delivered to interested listeners and actions immediately (that is, during Apply Request Values phase) rather than waiting until Invoke Application phase.

attribute.name: onbeforedomupdate
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called after the ajax response comes back, but before the DOM is updated

attribute.name: onclick
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is clicked over this element.

attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is double clicked over this element.

attribute.name: onkeydown
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a key is pressed down over this element.

attribute.name: onkeyup
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a key is released over this element.

attribute.name: onmousemove
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved within this element.

attribute.name: onmouseover
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved onto this element.

attribute.name: rel
attribute.description: The relationship from the current document to the anchor specified by this hyperlink. The value of this attribute is a space-separated list of link types.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: rev
attribute.description: A reverse link from the anchor specified by this hyperlink to the current document. The value of this attribute is a space-separated list of link types.

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: Name of the request status component that will indicate the status of the Ajax request

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.description: Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) to be applied when this element is rendered. This value must be passed through as the "class" attribute on generated markup.

attribute.name: resetValues

This will cause resetValue() to be called on any EditableValueHolder instances encountered as a result of this ajax transaction. If not specified, or the value is false, no such indication is made.

attribute.name: shape
attribute.description: The shape of the hot spot on the screen (for use in client-side image maps). Valid values are: default (entire region); rect (rectangular region); circle (circular region); and poly (polygonal region).

attribute.name: style
attribute.description: CSS style(s) to be applied when this component is rendered.

attribute.name: tabindex
attribute.description: This attribute specifies the position of the current element in the tabbing order for the current document. This value must be a number between 0 and 32767. User agents should ignore leading zeros

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The content type of the resource designated by this hyperlink.

component.name: jsFunction
component.description: The <a4j:jsFunction> component performs Ajax requests directly from JavaScript code and retrieves server-side data. The server-side data is returned in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format prior to the execution of any JavaScript code defined using the "oncomplete" attribute.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: MethodExpression representing the application action to invoke when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes no parameters, and returns an Object (the toString() of which is called to derive the logical outcome) which is passed to the NavigationHandler for this application.

This will cause resetValue() to be called on any EditableValueHolder instances encountered as a result of this ajax transaction. If not specified, or the value is false, no such indication is made.

attribute.description: The current value of this component.

The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes an ActionEvent parameter, with a return type of void, or to a public method that takes no arguments with a return type of void. Can be a single id, a space or comma separated list of Id's, or an EL Expression evaluating to an array or Collection. Any of the keywords "@this", "@form", "@all", "@none", "@region" may be specified in the identifier list. Some components make use of additional keywords. Default value is "@region" which resolves to this component if no region is present.

attribute.name: immediate
attribute.description: Flag indicating that, if this component is activated by the user, notifications should be delivered to interested listeners and actions immediately (that is, during Apply Request Values phase) rather than waiting until Invoke Application phase.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the generated javascript function

attribute.name: onbegin
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called before an ajax request.

attribute.name: onerror
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when the request results in an error

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: Name of the request status component that will indicate the status of the Ajax request

component.name: log
component.description: The <a4j:log> component generates JavaScript that opens a debug window, logging application information such as requests, responses, and DOM changes.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: The value binding expression used to wire up this component to a component property of a JavaBean class

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description: Determines how the log appears on the page, can be one of: "inline" (default), "popup" or "console". When set to "popup", the popup window is opened by pressing the key combination Ctrl + Shift + L. "console" mode will log messages in the JavaScript console.

attribute.name: style
attribute.description: CSS style(s) to be applied when this component is rendered.

attribute.name: hotkey
attribute.description: Key to open (in combination with Ctrl+Shift) the popup window. Default value is "L"

attribute.name: level
attribute.description: Sets the logging level, can be one of 'debug', 'info' (default), 'warn', 'error'.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.description: Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) to be applied when this element is rendered. This value must be passed through as the "class" attribute on generated markup.

component.name: mediaOutput
component.description: The <a4j:mediaOutput> component is used for generating images, video, sounds, and other resources defined on the fly.

attribute.name: accesskey
attribute.description: Access key that, when pressed, transfers focus to this element.

attribute.name: archive
attribute.description: Specifies a space-separated list of URIs

attribute.name: border
attribute.description: Deprecated. This attribute specifies the width of an IMG or OBJECT border, in pixels. The default value for this attribute depends on the user agent

attribute.name: charset
attribute.description: The character encoding of the resource designated by this hyperlink.

attribute.name: codebase
attribute.description: Base URI for classid, data, archive

attribute.name: coords
attribute.description: The attribute specifies shape and it position on the screen. Possible values: "rect: left-x, top-y, right-x, bottom-y", "circle: center-x, center-y, radius", "poly: x1, y1, x2, y2, ..., xN, yN".   Notes:  when giving the radius value in percents, user agents should calculate the final radius value in pixels based on the associated object's width and height; the radius value should be smaller than center-x and center-y values; for a polygon, the first and last coordinate pairs should have same x and y to close the shape (x1=xN; y1=yN) (when these coordinates are different, user agents should infer an additional pair to close a polygon).  Coordinates are relative to the top left corner of an object. All values are lengths. All values are comma separated.

attribute.name: declare
attribute.description: Declare but don't instantiate flag

attribute.name: disabled
attribute.description: Flag indicating that this element must never receive focus or be included in a subsequent submit. Default value - "false"

attribute.name: expires
attribute.description: The attribute allows to manage caching and defines the period after which a resource is reloaded.

attribute.name: hreflang
attribute.description: The language code of the resource designated by this hyperlink.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: Code describing the language used in the generated markup for this component.

attribute.name: mimeType
attribute.description: Geterated content mime-type for append to response header ( 'image/jpeg' etc )

attribute.name: onclick
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is clicked over this element.

attribute.name: onfocus
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when this element receives focus.

attribute.name: onkeypress
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a key is pressed and released over this element.

attribute.name: onmousedown
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is pressed down over this element.

attribute.name: onmouseout
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved away from this element.

attribute.name: onmouseup
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is released over this element.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: shape
attribute.description: The shape of the hot spot on the screen (for use in client-side image maps). Valid values are: default (entire region); rect (rectangular region); circle (circular region); and poly (polygonal region).

attribute.name: style
attribute.description: CSS style(s) to be applied when this component is rendered.

attribute.name: tabindex
attribute.description: Position of this element in the tabbing order for the current document. This value must be an integer between 0 and 32767.

attribute.name: title
attribute.description: Advisory title information about markup elements generated for this component.

attribute.name: uriAttribute
attribute.description: Get URI attribute for resource ( src for images, href for links etc ).

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: Data value calculated at render time and stored in URI (also as part of cache Key ), at generation time passed to send method. Can be used for update cache at change of generating conditions, and for creating beans as "Lightweight" pattern components (request scope).   IMPORTANT: Since serialized data stored in URI, avoid using big objects.

attribute.name: align
attribute.description: Deprecated. This attribute specifies the position of an IMG, OBJECT, or APPLET with respect to its context. The possible values are "bottom", "middle", "top", "left" and "right". The default value is "middle".

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: The value binding expression used to wire up this component to a component property of a JavaBean class

attribute.name: cacheable
attribute.description: Attribute is a flag that defines the caching strategy. If 'cacheable' is set to false, the response will not be cached. If it is set to true, it will be cached and the serialized value of 'value' attribute plays the role of a cache key.

attribute.name: classid
attribute.description: Identifies an implementation

attribute.name: codetype
attribute.description: Defines content type for code

attribute.name: createContent
attribute.description: Method call expression to send generated resource to OutputStream. It must have two parameter with a type of java.io.OutputStream and java.lang.Object ( deserialized value of data attribute )

attribute.name: dir
attribute.description: Direction indication for text that does not inherit directionality. Valid values are "LTR" (left-to-right) and "RTL" (right-to-left).

attribute.name: element
attribute.description: Get the Element name for rendering ( img , a , object, applet ).

attribute.name: fileName
attribute.description: Filename of the resource to be served

attribute.name: hspace
attribute.description: Deprecated. This attribute specifies the amount of white space to be inserted to the left and right of an IMG, APPLET, or OBJECT. The default value is not specified, but is generally a small, non-zero length

attribute.name: ismap
attribute.description: Use server-side image map

attribute.name: lastModified
attribute.description: The attribute allows to manage caching. A browser can send request with the header "If-Modified-Since" for necessity of object reloading. If time of modification is earlier, then the framework doesn't call generation and return code 304.

attribute.name: onblur
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when this element loses focus.

attribute.name: ondblclick
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is double clicked over this element.

attribute.name: onkeydown
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a key is pressed down over this element.

attribute.name: onkeyup
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a key is released over this element.

attribute.name: onmousemove
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved within this element.

attribute.name: onmouseover
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved onto this element.

attribute.name: rel
attribute.description: The relationship from the current document to the anchor specified by this hyperlink. The value of this attribute is a space-separated list of link types.

attribute.name: rev
attribute.description: A reverse link from the anchor specified by this hyperlink to the current document. The value of this attribute is a space-separated list of link types.

attribute.name: standby
attribute.description: Message to show while loading

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.description: Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) to be applied when this element is rendered. This value must be passed through as the "class" attribute on generated markup.

attribute.name: target
attribute.description: Name of a frame where the resource retrieved via this hyperlink is to be displayed.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The content type of the resource designated by this hyperlink.

attribute.name: usemap
attribute.description: Specifies an image as a client-side image-map

attribute.name: vspace
attribute.description: Deprecated. This attribute specifies the amount of white space to be inserted above and below an IMG, APPLET, or OBJECT. The default value is not specified, but is generally a small, non-zero length

component.name: outputPanel
component.description: The <a4j:outputPanel> component is used to group together components in to update them as a whole, rather than having to specify the components individually.   @author asmirnov@exadel.com

attribute.name: ajaxRendered
attribute.description: Defines, whether the content of this component must be (or not) included in AJAX response created by parent AJAX Container, even if it is not forced by reRender list of ajax action. Ignored if component marked to output by some Ajax action component. Default value - "false"

attribute.name: dir
attribute.description: Direction indication for text that does not inherit directionality. Valid values are "LTR" (left-to-right) and "RTL" (right-to-left).

attribute.name: keepTransient
attribute.description: Flag to mark all child components to non-transient. If true, all children components will be set to non-transient state and keep in saved components tree. For output in self-renderer region all content ( By default, all content in <f:verbatim> tags and non-jsf elements in facelets, marked as transient - since, self-rendered ajax regions don't plain output for ajax processing ).

attribute.name: layout
attribute.description: HTML layout for generated markup. Possible values: "block" for generating an HTML <div> element and "inline" for generating an HTML <span> element. Default value is "inline"

attribute.name: ondblclick
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is double clicked over this element.

attribute.name: onkeypress
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a key is pressed and released over this element.

attribute.name: onmousedown
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is pressed down over this element.

attribute.name: onmouseout
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved away from this element.

attribute.name: onmouseup
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is released over this element.

attribute.name: style
attribute.description: CSS style(s) to be applied when this component is rendered.

attribute.name: title
attribute.description: Advisory title information about markup elements generated for this component.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: The value binding expression used to wire up this component to a component property of a JavaBean class

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: Code describing the language used in the generated markup for this component.

attribute.name: onclick
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is clicked over this element.

attribute.name: onkeydown
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a key is pressed down over this element.

attribute.name: onkeyup
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a key is released over this element.

attribute.name: onmousemove
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved within this element.

attribute.name: onmouseover
attribute.description: Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved onto this element.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.description: Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) to be applied when this element is rendered. This value must be passed through as the "class" attribute on generated markup.

component.name: param
component.description: The <a4j:param> behavior combines the functionality of the JavaServer Faces (JSF) components <f:param> and <f:actionListener>.

attribute.name: assignTo
attribute.description: EL expression for updatable bean property. This property will be updated if the parent command component performs an actionEvent.

attribute.name: converter
attribute.description: The converter attribute can be used to specify how to convert the value before it is submitted to the data model.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the parameter associated with this component.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: Value of the parameter associated with this component.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: The value binding expression used to wire up this component to a component property of a JavaBean class

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.

attribute.name: noEscape
attribute.description: If set to true, the value will not enclosed within single quotes and there will be no escaping of characters. This allows the use of the value as JavaScript code for calculating value on the client-side. This doesn't work with non-AJAX components.

component.name: poll
component.description: The <a4j:poll> component allows periodical sending of Ajax requests to the server. It is used for repeatedly updating a page at specific time intervals.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: MethodExpression representing the application action to invoke when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes no parameters, and returns an Object (the toString() of which is called to derive the logical outcome) which is passed to the NavigationHandler for this application.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: The value binding expression used to wire up this component to a component property of a JavaBean class

attribute.name: data
attribute.description: Serialized (on default with JSON) data passed to the client by a developer on an AJAX request. It's accessible via "event.data" syntax. Both primitive types and complex types such as arrays and collections can be serialized and used with data

attribute.name: execute
attribute.description: Ids of components that will participate in the "execute" portion of the Request Processing Lifecycle. Can be a single id, a space or comma separated list of Id's, or an EL Expression evaluating to an array or Collection. Any of the keywords "@this", "@form", "@all", "@none", "@region" may be specified in the identifier list. Some components make use of additional keywords. Default value is "@region" which resolves to this component if no region is present.

attribute.name: immediate
attribute.description: Flag indicating that, if this component is activated by the user, notifications should be delivered to interested listeners and actions immediately (that is, during Apply Request Values phase) rather than waiting until Invoke Application phase.

attribute.name: limitRender
attribute.description: If "true", render only those ids specified in the "render" attribute, forgoing the render of the auto-rendered panels

attribute.name: onbegin
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called before an ajax request.

attribute.name: onerror
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when the request results in an error

attribute.name: render
attribute.description: Ids of components that will participate in the "render" portion of the Request Processing Lifecycle. Can be a single id, a space or comma separated list of Id's, or an EL Expression evaluating to an array or Collection. Any of the keywords "@this", "@form", "@all", "@none", "@region" may be specified in the identifier list. Some components make use of additional keywords

attribute.name: resetValues
attribute.description: If true, indicate that this particular Ajax transaction is a value reset transaction. This will cause resetValue() to be called on any EditableValueHolder instances encountered as a result of this ajax transaction. If not specified, or the value is false, no such indication is made.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: The current value of this component.

attribute.name: actionListener
attribute.description: MethodExpression representing an action listener method that will be notified when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes an ActionEvent parameter, with a return type of void, or to a public method that takes no arguments with a return type of void. In the latter case, the method has no way of easily knowing where the event came from, but this can be useful in cases where a notification is needed that "some action happened".

attribute.name: bypassUpdates
attribute.description: If "true", after process validations phase it skips updates of model beans on a force render response. It can be used for validating components input.

attribute.name: enabled
attribute.description: Enables/disables polling to the server. Using Expression Language (EL), the enabled attribute can point to a bean property to apply a particular attribute value

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.

attribute.name: interval
attribute.description: Specifies the time in milliseconds between requests. The default for this value is 1000 ms (1 second)

attribute.name: onbeforedomupdate
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called after the ajax response comes back, but before the DOM is updated

attribute.name: oncomplete
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called after the DOM is updated

attribute.name: ontimer
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called after the timer counts down, but before the Ajax request is initiated

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: Name of the request status component that will indicate the status of the Ajax request

component.name: push
component.description: The <a4j:push> component performs real-time updates on the client side from events triggered at the server side. The events are pushed out to the client through the RichFaces messaging queue (which is bound to Java Messaging Service - JMS). When the <a4j:push> component is triggered by a server event, it can in turn cause Ajax updates and changes.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: References the topic on the JMS server that contains the pushed messages

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.

attribute.name: onerror
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when an error has occurred with the push notifications

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: The value binding expression used to wire up this component to a component property of a JavaBean class

attribute.name: ondataavailable
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when a push notification is received

attribute.name: onsubscribed
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when push is subscribed successfully to the topic.

component.name: queue
component.description: The <a4j:queue> component manages the JSF queue of Ajax requests. It provides additional options for a finer control of request processing.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: The value binding expression used to wire up this component to a component property of a JavaBean class

attribute.name: ignoreDupResponses
attribute.description: Attribute allows you to ignore an Ajax response produced by a request if the newest 'similar' request is in the queue already. ignoreDupResponses="true" does not cancel the request while it is processed on the server, but just allows avoiding unnecessary updates on the client side if the response isn't actual now

attribute.name: onbeforedomupdate
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called before DOM is updated

attribute.name: onerror
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when an error has occurred during Ajax communications

attribute.name: onrequestqueue
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when the request is added to the queue

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: Name of the request status component that will indicate the status of the Ajax request going through the queue

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Specifies the name for the queue, allowing it to be referenced via the name attribute of the attachQueue component

attribute.name: oncomplete
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called after the request is completed

attribute.name: onrequestdequeue
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called after the request is removed from the queue

attribute.name: onsubmit
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called before an ajax request is submitted

attribute.name: requestDelay
attribute.description: Attribute defines the time (in ms) the request will be waiting in the queue before it is ready to be sent.

component.name: region
component.description: The <a4j:region> component specifies a part of the JSF component tree to be processed on the server. The region causes all the a4j and rich Ajax controls to execute: decoding, validating, and updating the model. The region causes these components to execute even if not explicitly declared. As such, processing areas can more easily be marked using a declarative approach.   Regions can be nested, in which case only the parent region of the component initiating the request will be processed.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: The value binding expression used to wire up this component to a component property of a JavaBean class

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.

component.name: repeat
component.description: The non-visual <a4j:repeat> component is used to iterate through a data model. The component renders child content for every iteration according to the current object data.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: The value binding expression used to wire up this component to a component property of a JavaBean class

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.

attribute.name: keepSaved
attribute.description: Boolean attribute that defines whether this iteration component will reset saved children's state before rendering. By default state is reset if there are no faces messages with severity error or higher.

attribute.name: rowKeyConverter
attribute.description: Converter for a row key object

attribute.name: rows
attribute.description: The number of rows to display, or zero for all remaining rows in the table

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: Points to the data model

attribute.name: first
attribute.description: A zero-relative row number of the first row to display

attribute.name: iterationStatusVar
attribute.description: Provides access to the iteration status in a Request scope

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: rowKeyVar
attribute.description: Provides access to the row key in a Request scope

attribute.name: stateVar
attribute.description: The attribute provides access to a component state on the client side

attribute.name: var
attribute.description: A request-scope attribute via which the data object for the current row will be used when iterating

component.name: status
component.description: The <a4j:status> component displays the status of current Ajax requests. The status can be either in progress, complete, or an error is shown after a failed request.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: The value binding expression used to wire up this component to a component property of a JavaBean class

attribute.name: errorStyleClass
attribute.description: The css class attribute used to style the error text

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.

attribute.name: onerror
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when the request results in an error

attribute.name: onstop
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when the request stops

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.

attribute.name: startStyleClass
attribute.description: The css class attribute used to style the start text

attribute.name: stopStyle
attribute.description: The css style attribute for the stop text

attribute.name: stopText
attribute.description: The text shown once the request is complete

attribute.name: errorStyle
attribute.description: The css style attribute for the error text

attribute.name: errorText
attribute.description: The text shown when an error has occurred

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the status component

attribute.name: onstart
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when the request starts

attribute.name: onsuccess
attribute.description: The client-side script method to be called when the request completes successfully

attribute.name: startStyle
attribute.description: The css style attribute for the start text

attribute.name: startText
attribute.description: The text shown after the request has been started and is currently in progress

attribute.name: stopStyleClass
attribute.description: The css class attribute used to style the stop text
